Package org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.amp.dimensions

This package contains the AMP non-trivial dimensions' definitions.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CategoriesDimension
    an amp_category_value-backed dimension consisting of (amp_category_class[level=0], amp_category_value[level=1])
    IndicatorConnectionDimension  
    LocationsDimension
    an ni_all_locations_with_levels-backed continuum dimension consisting of (country[level=0], region[level=1], zone[level=2], district[level=3], communal_section[level=4])
    OrganisationsDimension
    a ni_all_orgs_dimension-backed dimension consisting of (orgType[level = 0], orgGroup[level = 1], org[level = 2])
    ProgramsDimension
    a ni_all_programs_with_levels-backed continuum dimension consisting of (TOP_PROGRAM[level=0], PROGRAM[level=1], SUB_PROGRAM[level=2], SUB_SUB_PROGRAM[level=3] and so upto level 8)
    RawLocationsDimension
    an ni_all_locations_with_levels-backed dimension consisting of all locations [level=0]
    SectorsDimension
    a ni_all_sectors_with_levels-backed continuum dimension consisting of (TOP_SECTOR[level=0], SUB_SECTOR[level=1], SUB_SUB_SECTOR[level=2])

Package org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.amp.dimensions Description

This package contains the AMP non-trivial dimensions' definitions. The distinction between a trivial and non-trivial dimension is up to personal tastes, the one I used is: a view is considered trivial IFF it has a depth of 1 AND its backing store is a database table. The trivial dimensions are defined inline in AmpReportsSchema.
All the AMP dimensions are singletons for obvious reasons.
One can read more about them here (generic NiReports dimensions) and also here (the AMP database-backed cached dimensions) https://wiki.dgfoundation.org/display/AMPDOC/4.+The+AMP+NiReports+Schema#id-4.TheAMPNiReportsSchema-4.2.3.Thedimensions
